channel.title: KenSmith tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from KenSmith.

item.description: One more floundering U. S. institution, inspected by @Steve_Vladeck, who rightly points to our need to be persuaded, not just ruled or governed. https://t.co/FMcIG2FsLD

In their hearts, people want to, need to, have something they can believe in. Politicians whose first interest is in power corrode the hearts of the people, the heart of the nation. https://t.co/RxiBQfqx2r
Who needs TV . . . https://t.co/Ybhlfz32Qa

Something for Poetry Month. This poem refers to the one that follows. https://t.co/YsUL8nKXGY
Auden, writing in the 1930s, as the dictators were testing their options. https://t.co/Z6Kw0PWrUG
"It sounded like hope, stupid hope." https://t.co/pE0Y8D76Fr
The more a sermon is organized like a grocery list, the worse it is. Same goes for movies. https://t.co/cDO0qATukY

Went to the movies, saw two previews:
First preview: hunted by some vague malevolent creature, a young woman crawls out of a shadowy pile of furniture, studs and wallboard, suddenly to be dragged by the ankles back into the darkness screaming and clawing the floor with her fingernails.
Second preview: hunted by some vague malevolent creature, a young man crawls out of a shadowy pile of cabinets, studs and wallboard, suddenly to be dragged by the ankles back into the darkness screaming and clawing the floor with his fingernails.
"(What like a bullet can undeceive!)" https://t.co/2M2xDASbUf
At the 1862 battle of Shiloh, "more men died than in all previous wars fought by citizens of the United States." https://t.co/ymqMy1nv8j

While slamming this frantic fantasy movie, the reviewer defines cinema art as "the observation of life from the amplified perspective of imagination." https://t.co/pwzPpdPDfo
Fantasy done better, he says, is built of scenes of imagination that "prove its power to illuminate reality—creating a form to give experience an original and singular identity."

We're in that part of spring here when a great array of leaf shapes and shades of green are on offer in the wilder parks near us. Soon, though, many of these will be flowering, and we will try to get out there at least once a week until June. https://t.co/0A3Y3E7K0c
In our part of northern Indiana, at Bendix Woods, in April and May, the Big Tree Trail and Lower Big Tree Trail offer wonderful clues to the richness once common in North American plant life. There will be literally hundreds and hundreds of flowers soon.
https://t.co/dg9dnu0rtB
Because the Lower Big Tree dips down the hill from the Big Tree, the two trails have a somewhat different schedule of growth and bloom and, I suspect, set of plants on view. I look forward to heading down that hillside to see what's visible. https://t.co/c1HD38jHri
Here is a view from the Big Tree Trail in late April of 2021. https://t.co/EiXaxLgany
The sight of a woman on a bicycle was once considered disgusting and polluting. https://t.co/mp72gbm8bE https://t.co/cmC22QAZt4
A light tour of Wikipedia articles relating to "Web3" sure give the impression that it's mainly about money.

@davewiner Doing this or anything like it should be prohibited explicitly in departmental codes of conduct. Related in spirit: I've heard the suggestion that turning off body cameras should be a felony.
"Twitter is, in many ways, a platform of the elite. [It’s] most powerful as a communication tool for already prominent and influential people." https://t.co/fzQpl8PU9R
We know that people with co-morbidities are more readily brought down by C-19, and in retrospect this surely applies to nations too. https://t.co/UmdJ4SDm2M
@liamputt I will do my best not to make a mountain out of an anthill.

A tiny ant died on the screen of my laptop overnight, and when I tried to brush it away it fell and got lodged in the hinge. The Apple Helpline chatbot won't be of any help, I can tell. RIP, little buddy.
The nation's co-morbidities were surely visible by mid-April of 2020. https://t.co/KNmHfBBdGg

A hunch: Remove the barriers to team teaching by faculty from different fields, and the amount of innovation in higher education would triple. And: The more students got to study topics and problems in interdisciplinary settings, the more relevant they'd find their education.
Designing book pages is an enjoyable challenge. https://t.co/rvlimzkjMr
And Hallmark will introduce a line of thank-you cards to send to helpful robots. https://t.co/vLYkHJrNKI

Mike Pence spent a long time ignoring the people struggling with addiction who would die without access to clean needles.
. . . as Governor of Indiana.

Passers-by stopped to marvel seeing women honored this way, named and recognized for their work. A mother with tears patted her young daughter’s back, a pair of white-haired women clutched one another’s hands, saying, “This matters. This matters so much.” https://t.co/JtTUocdJyf
The Limerick of Sir Terwin https://t.co/JfgrZpQE0b
